articles.title: How an Elusive Banker Allegedly Kept North Korea’s Dirty Money Flowing
articles.mainIdea: How an Elusive Banker Allegedly Kept North Korea’s Dirty Money Flowing
articles.summary: The Wall Street Journal: How an Elusive Banker Allegedly Kept North Korea’s Dirty Money Flowing. The FBI is offering $7 million to catch Sim Hyon Sop, whose role according to U.S. officials is vital to Kim Jong Un’s regime.

articles.title: 3 surprises that could rattle markets in 2026, according to Morgan Stanley
articles.mainIdea: 3 surprises that could rattle markets in 2026, according to Morgan Stanley
articles.summary: Business Insider: 3 surprises that could rattle markets in 2026, according to Morgan Stanley. Morgan Stanley said it is eyeing a productivity boost and a changing regime for stocks and bonds as potential surprises in 2026.

articles.title: Inflation Is Ready to Come Roaring Back
articles.mainIdea: Inflation Is Ready to Come Roaring Back
articles.summary: Barrons.com: Inflation Is Ready to Come Roaring Back. The effects of tariffs, higher tax returns and even some policies designed to improve affordability could push prices higher. Related tickers mentioned: WMT.
